transcript.title: Doorstop Interview, Brisbane
transcript.content:
JOURNALIST:

...regarding the Governor-General?

PRIME MINISTER:

Well, I've just been informed of the court decision in Victoria. I understand that the Governor-General himself will shortly issue or make a statement and in those circumstances I don't have anything further to say at this time.

JOURNALIST:

Will you be taking legal advice on what to do [inaudible]?

PRIME MINISTER:

I don't have anything to add to what I've just said. The Governor-General will make a statement and I don't have anything to add at this time.

[ends]
